message_1: What is the slope of the line passing through the points (2, 3) and (4, 7)? Show your work.
message_2:
To find the slope of the line passing through the points (2, 3) and (4, 7), we can use the slope formula:

m = (y2 - y1) / (x2 - x1)

where m is the slope, (x1, y1) are the coordinates of the first point, and (x2, y2) are the coordinates of the second point.

Plugging in the given points, we have:

m = (7 - 3) / (4 - 2)

m = (4) / (2)

m = 2

So, the slope of the line passing through the points (2, 3) and (4, 7) is 2.
